{"step_by_step_thinking": "The third ventricle is a cavity in the brain filled with cerebrospinal fluid. It is located in the diencephalon. The floor of the third ventricle is formed by several structures, including the hypothalamus, the optic chiasm, the infundibulum, and the mammillary bodies. The optic stalk is not located on the floor of the third ventricle, it is a part of the developing eye in embryos. The third nerve, also known as the oculomotor nerve, does not form part of the floor of the third ventricle either.", "answer_choice": "B. Third nerve"}
